00048 /*****************************************************************************\
00049  *
00050  *  File:  header_reader.c
00051  *
00052  *  Description:
00053  *    Reads a header file and builds a symbol table from it
00054  *
00055  *  Creation Date :  April, 1993
00056  *
00057  *  Authors:  John C. Gyllenhaal, Wen-mei Hwu
00058  *
00059  *
00060 \*****************************************************************************/
00061 
00062 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00063 #include <config.h>
00064 #include <ctype.h>
00065 #include "hmdes.h"
00066 
00067 typedef struct hparse_info_st
00068 {
00069   Msymbol_Table *table;
00070   char *name;
00071   FILE *in;
00072   int line;
00073   int comment_level;
00074   int endif_level;
00075 }
00076 Hparse_Info;
00077 
00078 static void Hparse_line (char *ptr, char *name, char *arg);
00079 static int Hget_next_line (Hparse_Info * hinfo, char *ret_buf);
00080 static void Hskip_to_endif (Hparse_Info * hinfo, char *source, int line);
00081 
00082 Msymbol_Table *
00083 Hread_header_file (char *file_name)
00084 {
00085   Hparse_Info *hinfo;
00086   char buf[MLINE_SIZE];
00087   char name[MLINE_SIZE];
00088   char arg_buf[MLINE_SIZE];
00089   char *arg_ptr;
00090   char *prev_val;
00091   Msymbol_Table *table;
00092 
00093   /* Allocate header parse info structure */
00094   Malloc_struct ((void **) (&hinfo), sizeof (Hparse_Info));
00095 
00096   /* Initialize fields for parsing */
00097   Malloc_name (&hinfo->name, file_name);
00098   hinfo->line = 0;
00099   hinfo->table = Mcreate_symbol_table (file_name, 256);
00100   hinfo->comment_level = 0;
00101   hinfo->endif_level = 0;
00102 
00103   if ((hinfo->in = fopen (file_name, "r")) == NULL)
00104     H_punt ("Cannot open C header file '%s'", file_name);
00105 
00106   while (Hget_next_line (hinfo, buf) != EOF)
00107     {
00108       if (buf[0] != '#')
00109         continue;
00110 
00111       if ((strncmp ("#define", buf, 7) == 0) && (isspace (buf[7])))
00112         {
00113           /* Break line into name and arg (if any) */
00114           Hparse_line (&buf[8], name, arg_buf);
00115 
00116           /* Make sure name defined */
00117           if (name[0] == 0)
00118             H_punt ("error (%s line %i):\n    Name expected in define ('%s')",
00119                     hinfo->name, hinfo->line, buf);
00120 
00121           /* Make sure not already defined */
00122           if ((prev_val = Mfind_symbol (hinfo->table, name)) != NULL)
00123             H_punt
00124               ("error (%s line %i):\n    Redefinition of '%s' (prev val '%s')",
00125                hinfo->name, hinfo->line, name, prev_val);
00126 
00127           /* Allocate a copy of arg for the symbol table */
00128           Malloc_name (&arg_ptr, arg_buf);
00129 
00130           /* Insert defined value into symbol table */
00131           Minsert_symbol (hinfo->table, name, arg_ptr);
00132 
00133         }
00134       else if ((strncmp ("#undef", buf, 6) == 0) && (isspace (buf[6])))
00135         {
00136           /* Break line into name and arg (if any) */
00137           Hparse_line (&buf[7], name, arg_buf);
00138 
00139           /* Make sure name defined */
00140           if (name[0] == 0)
00141             H_punt ("error (%s line %i):\n    Name expected in define ('%s')",
00142                     hinfo->name, hinfo->line, buf);
00143 
00144           /* Make sure not already defined */
00145           if ((prev_val = Mfind_symbol (hinfo->table, name)) != NULL)
00146             H_punt ("Someone needs to implement #undef");
00147 
00148         }
00149       else if ((strncmp ("#ifdef", buf, 6) == 0) && (isspace (buf[6])))
00150         {
00151           /* Break line into name and arg (if any) */
00152           Hparse_line (&buf[7], name, arg_buf);
00153 
00154           /* If name not defined, skip to matching #endif */
00155           if (Mfind_symbol (hinfo->table, name) == NULL)
00156             Hskip_to_endif (hinfo, buf, hinfo->line);
00157         }
00158       else if ((strncmp ("#ifndef", buf, 7) == 0) && (isspace (buf[7])))
00159         {
00160           /* Break line into name and arg (if any) */
00161           Hparse_line (&buf[7], name, arg_buf);
00162 
00163           /* If name defined, skip to matching #endif */
00164           if (Mfind_symbol (hinfo->table, name) != NULL)
00165             Hskip_to_endif (hinfo, buf, hinfo->line);
00166         }
00167       else if (strncmp ("#endif", buf, 6) == 0)
00168         {
00169           /* Do nothing */
00170         }
00171       else if ((strncmp ("#include", buf, 8) == 0) && (isspace (buf[8])))
00172         {
00173           if (verbose)
00174             {
00175               fprintf (stderr, "warning (%s line %i):\n    '%s' ignored\n",
00176                        hinfo->name, hinfo->line, buf);
00177             }
00178         }
00179       else
00180         {
00181           H_punt ("warning (%s line %i):\n    Unsupported directive '%s'",
00182                   hinfo->name, hinfo->line, buf);
00183         }
00184     }
00185   fclose (hinfo->in);
00186 
00187   table = hinfo->table;
00188   free (hinfo->name);
00189   free (hinfo);
00190   return (table);
00191 }
00192 
00193 /*
00194  * Skips to the matching #endif for  a #ifdef or #ifndef
00195  */
00196 static void
00197 Hskip_to_endif (Hparse_Info * hinfo, char *source, int line)
00198 {
00199   char buf[MLINE_SIZE];
00200 
00201   hinfo->endif_level = 1;
00202   while (Hget_next_line (hinfo, buf) != EOF)
00203     {
00204       if (strncmp ("#ifdef ", buf, 7) == 0)
00205         {
00206           hinfo->endif_level++;
00207         }
00208       else if (strncmp ("#ifndef ", buf, 8) == 0)
00209         {
00210           hinfo->endif_level++;
00211         }
00212       else if (strncmp ("#endif", buf, 6) == 0)
00213         {
00214           hinfo->endif_level--;
00215           if (hinfo->endif_level == 0)
00216             return;
00217         }
00218     }
00219   H_punt ("%s: Hit EOF searching for the #endif matching '%s' on line %i",
00220           hinfo->name, source, line);
00221 }
00222 
00223 static void
00224 Hparse_line (char *ptr, char *name, char *arg)
00225 {
00226   int i;
00227 
00228   /* Strip white space before name */
00229   while (*ptr != 0 && isspace (*ptr))
00230     ptr++;
00231 
00232   /* Read name from buf */
00233   for (i = 0; ptr[i] != 0 && !isspace (ptr[i]); i++)
00234     name[i] = ptr[i];
00235   name[i] = 0;
00236 
00237   ptr += i;
00238 
00239   /* Skip white space before argument */
00240   while (*ptr != 0 && isspace (*ptr))
00241     ptr++;
00242 
00243   /* Read arg from buf */
00244   for (i = 0; ptr[i] != 0; i++)
00245     arg[i] = ptr[i];
00246   arg[i] = 0;
00247   return;
00248 }
00249 
00250 static int
00251 Hget_next_line (Hparse_Info * hinfo, char *ret_buf)
00252 {
00253   char in_buf[MLINE_SIZE], *buf;
00254   char *ptr;
00255   int i, pos;
00256 
00257   while (fgets (in_buf, MLINE_SIZE, hinfo->in) != NULL)
00258     {
00259       hinfo->line++;
00260 
00261       /* Detect lines that are too long */
00262       if (strlen (in_buf) >= (MLINE_SIZE - 1))
00263         H_punt ("%s line %i: Line too long. Max length = %i",
00264                 hinfo->name, hinfo->line, MLINE_SIZE - 1);
00265 
00266       /* Move to pointer so we can manipulate */
00267       buf = in_buf;
00268 
00269       /* Strip leading white space */
00270       for (; (*buf != 0) && Misspace (*buf); buf++)
00271         ;
00272 
00273       pos = 0;
00274       for (ptr = buf; *ptr != 0; ptr++)
00275         {
00276           /* Detect start of comment */
00277           if ((ptr[0] == '/') && (ptr[1] == '*'))
00278             {
00279               hinfo->comment_level++;
00280               ptr++;
00281               continue;
00282             }
00283 
00284           /* Detect end of comment */
00285           if ((ptr[0] == '*') && (ptr[1] == '/'))
00286             {
00287               hinfo->comment_level--;
00288               if (hinfo->comment_level < 0)
00289                 H_punt ("%s line %i: Unmatched '*/' (nesting allowed)",
00290                         hinfo->name, hinfo->line);
00291               ptr++;
00292               continue;
00293             }
00294 
00295           /* Copy info to ret buffer if not commented out */
00296           if (hinfo->comment_level == 0)
00297             {
00298               ret_buf[pos] = *ptr;
00299               pos++;
00300             }
00301         }
00302 
00303       /* Terminate ret_buf */
00304       ret_buf[pos] = 0;
00305 
00306       /* Strip trailing white space */
00307       for (i = pos - 1; (i >= 0) && isspace (ret_buf[i]); i--)
00308         ret_buf[i] = 0;
00309 
00310       /* If return buffer is not empty, return 0 */
00311       if (strlen (ret_buf) != 0)
00312         return (0);
00313     }
00314 
00315   /* Reaches here on EOF only */
00316   return (EOF);
00317 }
